NARRATION: **Enter Peter the Wolf** *A wolf walks in to the tattoo parlor. It's a big wolf, about a thousand pounds. It looks about lazily and then transforms back into Peter, carrying bags and bags of heavy gold coins.* *Peter immediately drops the bags on the floor.* "Sorry!" *he says.* "Sorry, I just needed some help carrying that. Here you go!" *He moves the bags one at a time onto the counter. They're somebody else's problem now.* "Now, then!" *Peter says.* "One barrier tattoo, please! This'll work in wild shape, right? Yes? Good!" *As for the image...* "A wolf!" *Peter says brightly.* "Howling at the moon!" "Wait, no! *Three* wolves, howling at the moon! I've heard it's lucky!" *Dripping wet, covered in blood, and bruises, and... stuff, Peter climbs the stairs and staggers out into Cheronika's room. He gives her a look.* "You had an invisible memory-eating monster in your basement," *he tells her.* "You locked the door and put up a sign, but we're adventurers, so that just made us want it more." "The monster is dead now, which probably means your memories are coming back. I imagine that's pretty traumatizing. If it makes you feel any better, you can go down in the basement and kick it a couple times. Don't mind the horse-sized snakes, they're mine." *Peter collapses in a chair. Hopefully a wooden chair and not an upholstered chair, but he'll take what he can get.* "We think you might have some sort of evil dungeon entrance in your basement, and we're going to go investigate that, but first we're going to rest for an hour. Hope that's okay." *Peter falls silent, except for the drip-drip-drip of the... stuff... pooling around him on the floor.*

PLAYER ACTION: Plans for the next run: * need to be more clear, at the start of the adventure, that you can find out what the final monster lineup is if you ask * the world map did not get used much. need to figure out if there's a way to make it more relevant, or else delete it * need to be more clear about the cost of going on a monster safari, like the ones that produced Ninetails and Primeape * need to be more clear about the value of breaking the void pillars, if I do the void battle again. maybe reset the damage from the rift whenever a pillar breaks? * maybe people should be allowed to do monster training before getting a voidstone? I kind of liked how it played out, where there was a frantic series of rolls to evolve all your key monsters before the final battle. but it could be sort of a bad feeling * maybe we should do fewer large battles. I liked the mid-adventure arena fight, and the final battle, but I think I could've left the void battle to smaller groups Things I liked: * six week runtime means the DM and players are less likely to burn out * allowing solo and pair quests makes good use of the play-by-post medium, and allows people to play at their own pace * generating stats for monsters turned out to not be as hard as I expected `!use -save dex -dc 15 -d 2d6[fire] half -title "Moltres uses Conflagration" -desc “All creatures within 10ft of Moltres take damage...” -t Scintillion -t Ariados -t -t Ratissimo **Professor Zalantar uses Inspire Confidence!** *When a monster would miss an attack, Professor Zalantar can spend a reaction to add +1d6 to the roll.* `!init aoo peter "Water Whip" custom -d "3d6[magical piercing]" -b 7

His plate armor is worn but functional; his shield bears a holy symbol you don't recognize. He walks with a cane.* "Back in my day, we didn't have none of this bigger-on-the-inside stuff. We had a crater, an' a door in it. The vaultkeeper's job was to make sure you didn't trip, walking down to the door." *He pauses in the hallway, looks confused, and turns around, leading you back the way you came.* "We did just fine, too. Then someone had the idea to put in a stairway, and that was the beginning of the end. Now it's all fractal multiverse dimensions every way you turn, can't ever figure out where I left my glasses. Don't know how my boy manages it." *He comes to a door and tries to open it. It's locked. He speaks a word like breaking glass, and your ears pop as a wave of air pressure washes over you. He tries the door again and it opens.* "Let's do this one," *he says.* "Don't worry. You seem like bright kids. You'll do fine." Soon, an eldritch horror will break through the dimensional barriers, manifesting its dreadful form in our reality. Note the word choice there. Not "might" break through; not "could" break through. An eldritch horror *will* break through. The stars are right, and getting righter by the day, and that only ever means one thing. *The young woman wears tight purple-and-black clothing, and a gigantic purple hat, with stars on it.* *She doesn't look like a master of astrology. But she speaks with confidence.* "Many people think the stars are giant balls of flaming gas in the sky. It's a common misconception." "In fact, the stars are echoes of alternate planes, filtered through our mortal two-dimensional vision." "Sophisticated trigonometric analysis can tell us where we are in the cosmos, and what we're close to. Dimensionally speaking." "Or, if we'd rather not do the math --" *she waves a hand, and a glowing blue star chart appears in front of her* -- "magic works too." *Her grin fades quickly.* "The portents are dire. We're much too close to something, and getting closer by the day." "I can't tell who it is, but it's clear that it's one of the Elder Gods. There's going to be an incursion." "And here's the problem. The stars aren't saying there *might* be an incursion. They're saying there *will* be an incursion." "Tonight, I'll be able to triangulate the exact location of the summoning. That's where you come in." "You'll go to the spot, wherever it is. There will be cultists. It's always cultists." "They'll be preparing to welcome their god into our reality. It will eat them first." "" "The Elder Gods have strengths and weaknesses. Domains and traits. Immunities and vulnerabilities." "I don't know what this one has. You'll have to figure it out." "But if you work fast, and you manage the environment, and play to its weaknesses, you should be able to kill it." "Do you have any questions for me, before tonight?"
